Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is unclear whether the item listed on eBay was the actual podium from the U.S. House or if it even left the building during the riots.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the item listed on eBay was the House of Representatives Speaker Podium without sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the listing and sale of the object could have been made as a joke, as indicated by the reverse-image search of the photograph used in the eBay listing.
Understate: The claim may understate the uncertainty surrounding the actual item listed on eBay and whether it was sold or not.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting conflicting information about the authenticity and sale of the item.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the item listed on eBay was the actual House of Representatives Speaker Podium, as it remains unknown.
